p.s: As the globalisation is a topic that is getting more and more important in everyday life the question about the importance of worldwide communication is coming up.
That is why I want to make everyone clear how important it is in todaystoday's world and also how important it is for the future of the UK to speak foreign languages.
As John Worne already mentioned in his article Language learning in the UK: can't, won't, don't, learning languages is important for prosperity and global standing in the UK.
Some people might say that there is no need to learn languages because of online-translatorsonline translators.
But I totally disagree with that argument because two people can not have a fluent dialogue if they have to tiptype everything they want to say in their mobile phone at first.
Some people might also say that there is no need to learn languages because it is not necessary for their everyday life.
They think that it is just necessary to speak the language of the country they are living in.
But let me proofprove you that they are wrong.
Speaking different languages is not just helpful for work but also for yoryour private life - your freetime.
No matter where you go, you will always meet somebody from aan other nation.
Sometimes this person can speak your language but sometimes this person can notcannot.
To be able to talk to them anyway it is important to speak their own language.
Or if you travel it is helpful to speak different languages too.
But more important is the aspect of work.
Because of the globalisation a lot of jobs are outsourced and international teamwork is necessary.
People from all over the world come together in the internet and work together and not everyone can speak English even thought it is the worldlanguage.
As Worne already mentioned a person who is able to speak different languages has more chance to get the job thenthan someone who just speaks English.
Furthermore England is a country with a high quote of export.
For the export, it is important to communicate with the firms from the other nations.
If that is not possible the firms will probably export from another nation where it is easier to communicate.
Because otherwise there is a high risk of misunderstanding.
lessLess exports would also mean less prosperity for the UK.
But not only for export but also for import it is important to speak different languages.
A lot of clothes in the UK come from developing countries like Bangladesh.
Especially the workers in Bangladesh are not really educated.
That is why they probably just speak their mother tongue.
To speak with them anyway it is important to speak their language.
There are also reasons why it is important for the global standing for the UK to be able to speak foreign languages.
The economical situation as well as the political situation in one country is important for the global standing.
Both situations just can be done good with the right communication.
Communication is the key to success in a country!
And communication is just possible if the people speak and understand the same language!
That is why it is so important to learn a foreign language.

If more people in the UK start to speak more different languages the process of globalisation can get even more forwards and the UK will have a good global satnding because of it'sits many workers who are able to work international.
